verses.verse: Then the men <WH376> of Ephraim <WH669> said <WH559> to him, "What <WH4100> is this <WH2088> thing <WH1697> you have done <WH6213> to us, not calling <WH7121> us when <WH3588> you went <WH1980> to fight <WH3898> against Midian <WH4080>?" And they contended <WH7378> with him vigorously. <WH2394>

But he said <WH559> to them, "What <WH4100> have I done <WH6213> now <WH6258> in comparison with you? Is not the gleaning <WH5955> [of the grapes] of Ephraim <WH669> better <WH2896> than <WH4480> the vintage <WH1210> of Abiezer <WH44>?

"God <WH430> has given <WH5414> the leaders <WH8269> of Midian, <WH4080> Oreb <WH6159> and Zeeb <WH2062> into your hands; <WH3027> and what <WH4100> was I able <WH3201> to do <WH6213> in comparison with you?" Then <WH227> their anger <WH7307> toward <WH4480> <WH5921> him subsided <WH7503> when he said <WH1696> that.
Then Gideon <WH1439> and the <WH300> men <WH376> who <WH834> were with him came <WH935> to the Jordan <WH3383> [and] crossed <WH5674> over, <WH5674> weary <WH5889> yet pursuing. <WH7291>

And he said <WH559> to the men <WH376> of Succoth, <WH5523> "Please <WH4994> give <WH5414> loaves <WH3603> of bread <WH3899> to the people <WH5971> who <WH834> are following <WH7272> me, for they are weary, <WH5889> and I am pursuing <WH7291> Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna, <WH6759> the kings <WH4428> of Midian. <WH4080>"

And the leaders <WH8269> of Succoth <WH5523> said, <WH559> "Are the hands <WH3709> of Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna <WH6759> already <WH6258> in your hands, <WH3027> that we should give <WH5414> bread <WH3899> to your army <WH6635>?"

And Gideon <WH1439> said, <WH559> "All right, <WH3651> when the Lord <WH3068> has given <WH5414> Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna <WH6759> into my hand, <WH3027> then I will thrash <WH1758> your bodies <WH1320> with the thorns <WH6975> of the wilderness <WH4057> and with briers. <WH1303>"

And he went <WH5927> up from there <WH8033> to Penuel, <WH6439> and spoke <WH1696> similarly <WH2088> to them; and the men <WH376> of Penuel <WH6439> answered <WH6030> him just <WH9201> as the men <WH376> of Succoth <WH5523> had answered. <WH6030>
So he spoke <WH559> also <WH1571> to the men <WH376> of Penuel, <WH6439> saying, <WH559> "When I return <WH7725> safely, <WH7965> I will tear <WH5422> down <WH5422> this <WH2088> tower. <WH4026>"

Now Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna <WH6759> were in Karkor, <WH7174> and their armies <WH4264> with them, about 15000 men, all <WH3605> who were left <WH3498> of the entire <WH3605> army <WH4264> of the sons <WH1121> of the east; <WH6924> for the fallen <WH5307> were 120000 swordsmen <WH376>. <WH8025> <WH2719>

And Gideon <WH1439> went <WH5927> up by the way <WH1870> of those who lived <WH7931> in tents <WH168> on the east <WH6924> of Nobah <WH5025> and Jogbehah, <WH3011> and attacked <WH5221> the camp, <WH4264> when the camp <WH4264> was unsuspecting. <WH983>

When Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna <WH6759> fled, <WH5127> he pursued <WH7291> them and captured <WH3920> the two <WH8147> kings <WH4428> of Midian, <WH4080> Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna, <WH6759> and routed <WH2729> the whole <WH3605> army. <WH4264>
Then Gideon <WH1439> the son <WH1121> of Joash <WH3060> returned <WH7725> from the battle <WH4421> by the ascent <WH4608> of Heres. <WH2776>

And he captured <WH3920> a youth <WH5288> from Succoth <WH5523> and questioned <WH7592> him. Then [the youth] wrote <WH3789> down <WH3789> for him the princes <WH8269> of Succoth <WH5523> and its elders, <WH2205> seventy-seven men. <WH376>

And he came <WH935> to the men <WH376> of Succoth <WH5523> and said, <WH559> "Behold <WH2009> Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna, <WH6759> concerning whom <WH834> you taunted <WH2778> me, saying, <WH559> 'Are the hands <WH3709> of Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna <WH6759> already <WH6258> in your hand, <WH3027> that we should give <WH5414> bread <WH3899> to your men <WH376> who are weary <WH3287>?'"

And he took <WH3947> the elders <WH2205> of the city, <WH5892> and thorns <WH6975> of the wilderness <WH4057> and briers, <WH1303> and he disciplined <WH3045> the men <WH376> of Succoth <WH5523> with them.
And he tore <WH5422> down <WH5422> the tower <WH4026> of Penuel <WH6439> and killed <WH2026> the men <WH376> of the city. <WH5892>

Then he said <WH559> to Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna, <WH6759> "What <WH375> kind <WH375> of men <WH376> [were] they whom <WH834> you killed <WH2026> at Tabor <WH8396>?" And they said, <WH559> "They were like <WH3644> you, each one <WH259> resembling <WH8389> the son <WH1121> of a king. <WH4428>"

And he said, <WH559> "They [were] my brothers, <WH251> the sons <WH1121> of my mother. <WH517> [As] the Lord <WH3068> lives, <WH2416> if <WH3863> only <WH3863> you had let them live, <WH2421> I would not kill <WH2026> you."

So he said <WH559> to Jether <WH3500> his first-born, "Rise, <WH6965> kill <WH2026> them." But the youth <WH5288> did not draw <WH8025> his sword, <WH2719> for he was afraid, <WH3372> because <WH3588> he was still <WH5750> a youth. <WH5288>

Then Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna <WH6759> said, <WH559> "Rise <WH6965> up yourself, <WH859> and fall <WH6293> on us; for as the man, <WH376> so is his strength. <WH1369>" So Gideon <WH1439> arose <WH6965> and killed <WH2026> Zebah <WH2078> and Zalmunna, <WH6759> and took <WH3947> the crescent <WH7720> ornaments <WH7720> which <WH834> were on their camels' necks. <WH6677>

Then the men <WH376> of Israel <WH3478> said <WH559> to Gideon, <WH1439> "Rule <WH4910> over us, both <WH1571> you and your son, <WH1121> also <WH1571> your son <WH1121>'s son, for you have delivered <WH3467> us from the hand <WH3027> of Midian. <WH4080>"
But Gideon <WH1439> said <WH559> to them, "I will not rule <WH4910> over you, nor <WH3808> shall my son <WH1121> rule <WH4910> over you; the Lord <WH3068> shall rule <WH4910> over you."

Yet Gideon <WH1439> said <WH559> to them, "I would request <WH7596> <WH7592> of you, that each <WH376> of you give <WH5414> me an earring <WH5141> from his spoil. <WH7998>" (For they had gold <WH2091> earrings, <WH5141> because <WH3588> they were Ishmaelites. <WH3459>)

And they said, <WH559> "We will surely <WH5414> give <WH5414> [them.]" So they spread <WH6566> out a garment, <WH8071> and every <WH376> one <WH376> of them threw <WH7993> an earring <WH5141> there <WH8033> from his spoil. <WH7998>

And the weight <WH4948> of the gold <WH2091> earrings <WH5141> that he requested <WH7592> was 1700 [shekels] of gold, <WH2091> besides <WH905> <WH4480> the crescent <WH7720> ornaments <WH7720> and the pendants <WH5188> and the purple <WH713> robes <WH899> which <WH7945> [were] on the kings <WH4428> of Midian, <WH4080> and besides <WH905> <WH4480> the neck <WH6060> bands <WH6060> that [were] on their camels' necks. <WH6677>

And Gideon <WH1439> made <WH6213> it into an ephod, <WH646> and placed <WH3322> it in his city, <WH5892> Ophrah, <WH6084> and all <WH3605> Israel <WH3478> played <WH2181> the harlot <WH2181> with it there, <WH8033> so that it became <WH1961> a snare <WH4170> to Gideon <WH1439> and his household. <WH1004>

So Midian <WH4080> was subdued <WH3665> before <WH6440> the sons <WH1121> of Israel, <WH3478> and they did not lift <WH5375> up their heads <WH7218> anymore. <WH3254> And the land <WH776> was undisturbed <WH8252> for forty <WH705> years <WH8141> in the days <WH3117> of Gideon. <WH1439>
Then Jerubbaal <WH3378> the son <WH1121> of Joash <WH3060> went <WH1980> and lived <WH3427> in his own house. <WH1004>
Now Gideon <WH1439> had <WH1961> seventy <WH7657> sons <WH1121> who were his direct <WH3409> descendants, <WH3318> for he had <WH1961> many <WH7227> wives. <WH802>
And his concubine <WH6370> who <WH834> was in Shechem <WH7927> also <WH1571> bore <WH3205> him a son, <WH1121> and he named <WH8034> <WH7760> him Abimelech. <WH40>

And Gideon <WH1439> the son <WH1121> of Joash <WH3060> died <WH4191> at a ripe <WH2896> old <WH7872> age <WH7872> and was buried <WH6912> in the tomb <WH6913> of his father Joash, <WH1> in Ophrah <WH3060> of the Abiezrites. <WH6084>

Then it came <WH1961> about, as soon <WH9201> as Gideon <WH1439> was dead, <WH4191> that the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> again <WH7725> played <WH2181> the harlot <WH2181> with the Baals, <WH1168> and made <WH7760> Baal-berith their god. <WH430>

Thus the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> did not remember <WH2142> the Lord <WH3068> their God, <WH430> who had delivered <WH5337> them from the hands <WH3027> of all <WH3605> their enemies <WH340> on every <WH5439> side; <WH5439>

nor <WH3808> did they show <WH6213> kindness <WH2617> to the household <WH1004> of Jerubbaal <WH3378> ([that is,] Gideon <WH1439>), in accord with all <WH3605> the good <WH9186> that he had done <WH6213> to Israel. <WH3478>
